results.title: Ariadne auf Naxos
results.brief_description: The Metropolitan Opera production of Richard Strauss’s “Ariadne auf Naxos” stars Jessye Norman tells of Ariadne who saved Prince Theseus of Athens from the perils of the Cretan labyrinth. She becomes his lover and joins him on his travels. Faithless Theseus deserts her on Naxos and she awaits death, inconsolable and heart-broken.

results.title: Arguing the Toss of a Cat
results.brief_description: This lighthearted comedy features Victor the cat who wanders around a block of flats in a Melbourne dockside suburb. Rose and William are a young couple sharing the upstairs flat. Rose is a jazz singer auditioning for an overseas tour with a famous jazz band. William draws pictures for children’s storybooks. Rose wants William to go with her but William wants to stay put. They draw comfort from Victor and use him as a sounding board for their own side of what turns into an argument. However, the other two tenants want Victor to share their problems too.

results.title: Argentina: land of natural wonder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Geographically, Argentina (which is Spanish for “silver”) is the eighth largest country in the world. This colourful guided tour takes us through the highlights of Argentina’s landscape and history. From chilly Tierra del Fuego, the country’s southern-most region, to Aconcagua, the tallest mountain in the western hemisphere. Much of the program is devoted to the sweeping plains of Patagonia, home of the Argentinian cowboy - the gaucho. The video also introduces us to Argentinian wildlife, the beaches of Mar del Plata, the world’s only growing glacier, Perito Mereno and the sights and nightspots of Buenos Aires.

results.title: Argentina
results.brief_description: Buenos Aires is the commercial, industrial, and financial centre of Argentina; the inland pampas region is the source of Argentina’s wealth. The interdependence of the city and the agricultural area is emphasised.

results.title: Argentina
results.creator_credit: Deborah Hinnigan, Colin Napthine and Pilot Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Argentina is a land of many contrasts, a land where the magnificent desolation of Patagonia and the Andes contrast dramatically with the urban frenzy of Buenos Aires, one of the world’s largest and most cosmopolitan cities. In this instalment of ‘The Lonely planet’ series, traveller Justine Shapiro visits Iguazu Falls, travels on one of the most spectacular railway journeys in Latin America, spends a day with gauchos, learns to tango, and visits the San Moreno glacier at the tip of Latin America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deborah Hinnigan, Colin Napthine and Pilot Films

results.title: Area theorems
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Donald Batchelor
results.brief_description: Using animated shapes and the manipulation of models (translation and rotation) the facts concerning the area of the triangle, parallelogram and trapezium are demonstrated. An episode from the series “Vision in Mathematics”. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.

results.title: Area schools of Tasmania
results.brief_description: The first scene of this film shows some attractive views of rural scenery in Tasmania. It is perhaps easier to make rural life in Tasmania attractive than in some of the other Australian states, for Tasmania has been blessed with many rural scenes of great beauty. Most of these shots were taken in the Huon Valley; the camera then lingers on an Area School at Huonville. There must be, however, in all the other Australian states many attractive rural districts which would provide a suitable environment for an Area school. Tasmania has many attractive one-teacher schools. The school shown is situated at Longley in the mountain district behind Mount Wellington. Since the introduction of the first Area school, however, the number of small rural schools in Tasmania has been diminished by about one hundred.

results.title: Area III: Barbara finds the formula
results.brief_description: A girl explores an imaginary place called Arealand where she learns the formula for the area of a rectangle: A = L x W, and meets the hectare and the square kilometre. No other credits available. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.
